newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela sells $17 mln of oil bonds in 2 days.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela sells $17 mln of oil bonds in 2 days.

text.p: Venezuela sold 8.32 billion bolivars ($17 million) of oil bonds backed by state-owned oil company PdVSA to small investors in the first two days of the offering, PdVSA subsidiary Sofip said.

Nearly 13,000 Venezuelans participated in the scheme, that has been designed to spread popular participation in the country's oil industry, including President Rafael Caldera who symbolically purchased a bond Thursday.
Small investors will be able to purchase the paper, that yields 12.75 percent, until next Friday. Thereafter mutual funds, and then international investors, will be able to participate.
The ceiling on the issue is 30 billion bolivars.
